text.title: Thermodynamic Properties of Aqueous Sodium Chloride Solutions
text.authors: Kenneth S. Pitzer, J. Christopher Peiper, and R. H. Busey
text.venue: Journal of Physical and Chemical Reference Data 13, 1

tables.name: Table A-1
tables.description: \text{The Standard Gibbs Energies of Water and NaCl(aq), Debye-Huckel Parameter } A\phi \text{ and NaCl Virial Parameters at t and P. } G^0_1(T,P) \text{ is the Gibbs Energy of Water, } G^0_1(T,P) - H^0_1(\text{0 K, 1 atm})^\phi \text{, and } G^0_2 \text{ the Gibbs energy for NaCl(aq) in its Standard State,} G^0_2(T,P) - H^0_2(\text{298 K, 1 atm})\text{. Note that } C_{NaCl} = C^\phi_{NaCl}/2.

tables.name: Table A-2
tables.description: \text{The Standard Entropies of Water and NaCl(aq), Debye-Huckel Parameter } A_S \text{ and NaCl Virial Parameters at t and P. } S^0_1(T,P) \text{ and } S^0_2(T,P) \text{ are Absolute Entropies, i.e., they are Referenced to States Approaching Zero Entropy at 0 K.}

tables.name: Table A-3
tables.description: \text{The Standard Enthalpies of Water and NaCl(aq), Debye-Huckel Parameter } A_L \text{ and NaCl Virial Parameters at t and P. } H^0_1 \text{ is the Enthalpy of Water, }  H^0_1(T,P) - H^0_1(\text{0 K, ideal gas})\text{ and } H^0_2 \text{ the Enthalpy of NaCl(aq) in its Standard State, }  H^0_2(T,P) - H^0_2(\text{298 K, 1 atm}).
